intro: Symplocos cochinchinensis var. versteegii, commonly known as the Vietnamese beautyberry, is a deciduous shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered, bright purple berries that are highly ornamental. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are elliptical,革质 (leathery), and have a smooth texture. The flowers are white and borne in clusters, adding to its aesthetic appeal in the landscape.
